results.firPara: Rio Ferdinand says that Dimitri Payet has a debt to West Ham United, as he criticised the France winger for the manner in which he has attempted to drive a move back to his previous club, Marseille.
results.secPara: Ferdinand, who began his playing career at West Ham, sided firmly with the clubs supporters, who have been left to rage over Payets behaviour, while he also questioned the type of advice that the player had been given, adding he would make the forward sit and rot.
results.webTitle: Dimitri Payet should respect West Ham and their fans, says Rio Ferdinand

results.firPara: A late Shane Long winner sent Southampton through to the final of the League Cup at Liverpools expense
results.secPara: A late Shane Long winner sent Southampton through to the final of the League Cup at Liverpools expense
results.webTitle: Liverpool v Southampton: EFL Cup semi-final second leg – as it happened

results.firPara: For Southampton, it was a night they will cherish for a long time and a victory that will go straight into the list of great occasions in the clubs history. Liverpool, the eight-times winners, had been knocked out and over two legs what a tribute to Claude Puels disciplined, talented players that they made it feel like a trick of the mind their opponents were actually the Premier Leagues highest scorers.
results.secPara: The prize is a Wembley final on 26 February and, on this evidence, Southampton will fancy their chances even if the likely opponents are Manchester United and a modern-day re-enactment of the 1976 FA Cup final. Why, after all, be afraid after this kind of heroic performance? Southampton had not conceded a goal in 180 minutes against a team that apparently wants to be thought of as title challengers. Liverpool simply ran out of ideas before the final, decisive blow from Shane Long in stoppage time, scoring from a break-away attack that started all the way back in his own penalty area.
results.webTitle: Shane Long drives superb Southampton past Liverpool into EFL Cup final

results.firPara: Egypt win the group and will meet Morocco in the quarter-final. Ghana will face DR Congo and, perhaps, Senegal if they reach the semis but their chances of getting that far will depend heavily on the fitness of Asamoah Gyan, who limped of here with groin trouble. Ghana have a great attitude and some strong and technically gifted players, but without Gyan they look very blunt. Egypt, meanwhile, have finished top despite scoring only two goals theyre solid and look well equipped to annoy plenty of other opponents.
results.secPara: 90 min There will be at least three more minutes. But they could play for another six months and Ghana still wouldnt score.
results.webTitle: Egypt v Ghana: Afcon 2017 – as it happened

results.firPara: December 2004 The offshore-registered developer Renewal begins purchasing land on the New Bermondsey site.
results.secPara: 2006 Renewal approaches Lewisham council with a view to a mixed-use development on the site.
results.webTitle: Millwall and the battle over The Den: how the controversy has unfolded

results.secPara: Watford have beaten off a host of clubs to sign MBaye Niang from Milan on an initial six-month deal. West Ham United, Everton, Burnley and Genoa were among the clubs interested in acquiring the mercurial 22-year-old but Walter Mazzarri was able to convince him to move to Vicarage Road until the end of the season.
results.webTitle: Watford sign Milan’s M’Baye Niang on loan with £13.5m option to buy

results.firPara: The plan to evict Millwall from their land around The Den by compulsory purchase order (CPO) has been abandoned after months of fierce public pressure. In a statement Lewisham councils elected mayor, Sir Steve Bullock, said that the CPO on Millwalls land should not proceed, pulling the plug on the plan that could have threatened the clubs future existence in its historical south London home.
results.secPara: Residents threatened with eviction by the £1bn regeneration scheme will also be celebrating as a concerted campaign to expose the plans to detailed scrutiny has finally borne fruit.
results.webTitle: Millwall CPO scrapped as Lewisham mayor calls time on development plan

results.firPara: The former Manchester United defender has agreed a move back to France while Burnley had a £10m bid for Robert Snodgrass accepted.
results.secPara: And that, ladies and gentlemen, is it for today. It started very well with an actual signing in the morning – Anton Donker joined Everton on loan from Wolfsburg – and then we had excitement with Burnley having their £10m bid for Robert Snodgrass accepted and Palace agreeing an initial deal of £9m for Robbie Brady but, frankly, we expected more with only six days left of the transfer window. Either way, its been enjoyable so please join us again tomorrow when there may well be some Swedish metal rock videos. Unless, there are some actual transfer news of course … have a good night everyone.
results.webTitle: Transfer window: Patrice Evra joins Marseille from  Juventus – as it happened!

results.firPara: Burnley, Middlesbrough and West Ham United are in contention to sign Robert Snodgrass after Hull named their price for the Scotland international.
results.secPara: Having previously rejected a number of offers for the 29-year-old, Hull finally relented on Wednesday morning when Burnley submitted a bid of an initial £7.5m with up to £2.5m in bonuses. That has yet to be matched by either Middlesbrough or West Ham, although it understood they have indicated they would be willing to slightly improve their offers of £7m plus £3m in bonuses to land the player who has scored seven goals in the Premier League this season.
results.webTitle: Burnley, Middlesbrough and West Ham in contention for Hull’s Robert Snodgrass

results.secPara: In todays Fiver Southend, Millwall, meats and comestibles
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Southend and the dismissal of their groundsman
